result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D Casper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory court costs assessed.  To be paid during period of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
It is a condition of probation that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Take medications as prescribed.
Vocational training.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.
Alcoho/drugl assessment and follow through with recommendations. Random UA's at discretion of agent.

Status conference at 11-24-2015 08:30 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Joshua D Casper in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Joshua D Casper in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State is requesting that bond be increased to $500 cash.
Defense requests that bond be reinstated.
If deft is released, he does not qualify for SPD representation.
BTC: VACATE WARRANT, reinstate bond, modify bond to $400 cash, all other conditions remain the same.  Status conference scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in custody; original warrant in file.
